subject: Creativity
title: Remote Associations: Connecting Unrelated Ideas
description: A 60-second lesson on Remote Associations: Connecting Unrelated Ideas.

hook.text: What connects 'cottage,' 'Swiss,' and 'cake'? The answer is 'cheese.' Creative minds make these leaps faster.

buildup.text: Sarnoff Mednick proposed in 1962 that creativity is the ability to form remote associations.

discovery.text: His Remote Associates Test (RAT) measures how quickly you connect three seemingly unrelated words.

punchline.text: Creativity is connecting dots others don't even see.

quiz.question: What does the Remote Associates Test measure?
options: Ability to connect seemingly unrelated concepts
